intro: Wettinia lanata, commonly known as the woolly wettinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy, or lanate, leaves that give it its common name. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Wettinia lanata is often found growing in humid, shaded environments such as montane forests.
